subject: College Athletics
Basketball
lead_paragraph: Ohio State must pay its former men’s coach Jim O’Brien more than $2.4 million for his wrongful firing in 2004, an appeals court ruled yesterday. The 10th District Court of Appeals also ruled that O’Brien should not receive an additional $1.3 million that he had said he was owed.University lawyers had argued that O’Brien should not receive any money.O’Brien, the coach of the Buckeyes from 1998 to 2004, was fired after he revealed that he had loaned a recruit $6,000.
